page.title: 09VILLAGE OF KINGSTHORPE
page.content: THERE ARE MANY WELL-KEPT COTTAGES AND CONVERTED BARNS GROUPED AROUND THE CHURCH OF ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST WHICH IS SITUATED BY THE TRIANGULAR GREEN, USED FOR FETES AND ALSO POPULAR WITH BRIDES AND GROOMS FOR WEDDING PHOTOGRAPHS.ON THE RIVER SIDE BELOW THE CHURCH THERE IS A REED BED, WHICH WAS DELIBERATELY FLOODED TO PROVIDE THATCHING FOR THE VILLAGE. THERE IS A RAILWAY JUST OUT- SIDE THE VILLAGE, ALONGSIDE THE RIVER. BETWEEN THE RAILWAY AND THE VILLAGE THE COUNCIL ARE BUILDING A NATURE TRAIL. TO THE EAST OF THE VILLAGE IS AN ESTATE OF MATURE HOUSES AND BUNGALOWS,BUILT QUITE CLOSELY TOGETHER ALONGSIDE NARROW ROADS.THE ESTATE IS WELL SET OUT WITH WELL-TENDED GARDENS BEHIND NEATLY CLIPPED HEDGES AND IS A QUIET AND ATTRACTIVE PLACE TO LIVE, BEING CLOSE TO THE BUSTLING SHOPPING CENTRE AND ALSO KINGSTHORPE RECREATION GROUND.
